intro: Glomera pleiotricha, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals, often arranged in clusters. It is native to regions in Central and South America and thrives in warm, humid climates. Glomera pleiotricha is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it a valuable plant in certain agricultural contexts.
